newsitem.title: USA: Florida's citrus sees ideal growing weather - FASS.
newsitem.headline: Florida's citrus sees ideal growing weather - FASS.

text.p: More rain, hot temperatures and high humidity provided near ideal growing conditions this week in the Florida citrus belt, the Florida Agricultural Statistics Service (FASS) said in its weekly Weather and Crop News report.

There is an abundance of new growth on citrus trees of all ages in all areas, FASS said, with new crop fruit continuing to make excellent progress. However, recent rainfall has generated a tremendous amount of weed growth in and around all groves.
Groves that have had little little production care recently and no mowing or cutting of the cover crops are showing stress in the form of light green foliage color, according to FASS.
Caretakers in the region are cutting cover crops and applying herbicides, summer sprays and fertilizations. Pushing and burning dead trees continues, FASS said.
